intro: Cischweinfia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf cischweinfia, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
